Akhir Pekan, IHSG Melemah 21 Poin, Mayoritas Bursa Asia Variatif
01 Nov 2019, 21:33 by Miechell Octovy Koagouw


Akhir Pekan, IHSG Melemah 21 Poin, Mayoritas Bursa Asia Variatif

KBRN, Jakarta : Menutup akhir pekan, Indeks Harga Saham Gabungan (IHSG) ditutup melemah 21 poin (0,34 persen) ke level 6.207 pada perdagangan Bursa Efek Indonesia di Jakarta, seperti dilansir Antara, Jumat (1/11/2019).Angka tersebut menempatkan IHSG ke zona merah. Penyebab melemahnya IHSG diprakirakan karena dorongan sentimen domestik dan global.Aksi profit taking dan ketidakpastian hubungan dagang AS-Tiongkok juga menjadi penyebab yang harus diperhitungkan.Pelemahan IHSG terjadi di tengah mayoritas bursa Asia yang variatif. Indeks Nikkei 225 Jepang ditutup turun 0,33 persen. Indeks Hang Seng Hong Kong menguat 0,72 persen dan Indeks Shanghai Komposit China naik hampir 1 persen.Seperti dilansir RTI, dari 562 saham yang diperdagangkan, sebanyak 135 menguat, 299 melemah, dan 128 stagnan. Frekuensi perdagangan tercatat 580.645 kali dengan 18,81 miliar lembar saham diperjualbelikan dan nilai transaksi mencapai Rp9,14 triliun.Dari sembilan sektor penggerak IHSG, tujuh sektor turun dan dua sektor naik. Sektor aneka industri menjadi pemberat laju indeks setelah turun 1,87 persen, diikuti pertambangan 1,8 persen, dan infrastruktur 1,58 persen.

Weekend, JCI Weakened 21 Points, Majority of Asian Stocks Variative
01 Nov 2019, 21:33 by Miechell Octovy Koagouw


Weekend, JCI Weakened 21 Points, Majority of Asian Stocks Variative

KBRN, Jakarta: Closing the weekend, the Composite Stock Price Index (CSPI) closed down 21 points (0.34 percent) to 6,207 in the Indonesian Stock Exchange trading in Jakarta, as reported by Antara on Friday (1/11/2019). This puts the JCI in the red zone. The cause of the weakening of the JCI is predicted due to the encouragement of domestic and global sentiment. The action of profit taking and the uncertainty of US-China trade relations are also causes that must be taken into account. Japan's Nikkei 225 index closed down 0.33 percent. Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index rose 0.72 percent and China's Shanghai Composite Index rose nearly 1 percent. As reported by the RTI, of 562 shares traded, as many as 135 gained, 299 weakened, and 128 stagnated. The frequency of trading was recorded 580,645 times with 18.81 billion shares traded and the transaction value reached Rp9.14 trillion. Of the nine IHSG driving sectors, seven sectors declined and two sectors rose. The multifarious industry sector became the ballooning index rate after falling 1.87 percent, followed by mining 1.8 percent and infrastructure 1.58 percent.
